abstract: Insurers are hoping that a new competitor to Gilead Sciences’ drugs for the disease will drive down prices, though the new drug’s price is higher than was hoped.
snippet: Insurers are hoping that a new competitor to Gilead Sciences’ drugs for the disease will drive down prices, though the new drug’s price is higher than was hoped.
lead_paragraph: A new treatment for hepatitis C developed by AbbVie won approval from the Food and Drug Administration on Friday, setting the stage for a marketing battle with Gilead Sciences, whose two new drugs for the disease have drawn an outcry about the high cost of medicines.

headline.main: Hepatitis C Treatment Wins Approval, but Price Relief May Be Limited
headline.print_headline: Hepatitis C Treatment Wins Approval, but Price Relief May Be Limited
